message_1: A student is tasked to count the number of ways to partition the number 6 into at most 3 positive integers. How many ways are there to do this?
message_2:
We can solve this problem by listing all the possible partitions of 6 into at most 3 positive integers:

1. (6) - one integer
2. (5, 1) - two integers
3. (4, 2) - two integers
4. (3, 3) - two integers
5. (4, 1, 1) - three integers
6. (3, 2, 1) - three integers

There are 6 ways to partition the number 6 into at most 3 positive integers.
